title: Athletes see climate change as threatening their sports and their health
summary: Professional athletes are increasingly concerned about how climate change affects their ability to train and compete. Indian triathlete Pragnya Mohan had to relocate her training to the UK due to extreme heat in her home country, highlighting growing challenges faced by athletes worldwide.
content:
Professional athletes around the world are raising their voices about the impact of climate change on sports and athletic performance. In Baku, Azerbaijan, the effects are becoming increasingly apparent.

Pragnya Mohan, a veteran triathlete with nearly ten years of professional experience, has found herself unable to continue training in her native India due to extreme heat conditions. The rising temperatures have forced her to relocate her training base to the United Kingdom.

This relocation represents a growing trend among athletes who must adapt their training regimens and competition schedules to cope with changing climate conditions. Athletes are not just concerned about their performance but also about their health and safety as temperatures continue to rise globally.
